thread.title: Gabon's Aubameyang stars, Dortmund routs Augsburg 5-1 in Bundesliga - World

author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Gabon's Aubameyang stars, Dortmund routs Augsburg 5-1 in Bundesliga - World
text:
Related Aubameyang on fire for Dortmund, Klopp in Anfield bow Barca want Gabon's red-hot Aubameyang: Reports African players week in Europe: Aubameyang reaches 10 Bundesliga goals African players week in Europe: Amazing Aubameyang Germany goal run continues Dortmund fans title chants fire us up: Aubameyang Gabon's Aubameyang scores twice as Borussia Dortmund win in Bundesliga Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored a hat trick and Shinji Kagawa starred as Borussia Dortmund routed bottom side Augsburg 5-1 in the Bundesliga on Sunday.
Aubameyang opened the scoring in the 18th minute and Marco Reus made it 2-0 three minutes later, when Kagawa turned a defender one way then the other before crossing for the Germany forward.
Kagawa back-heeled the ball for Reus to claim his second in the 33rd and Aubameyang slid in to convert substitute Adrian Ramos' shot at the far post in the 85th, after Augsburg's Raul Bobadilla had reduced the deficit in the 49th.
Kagawa provided his third assist in injury time, when Aubameyang became the first Dortmund player to score 13 goals in just 10 league games.
Borussia Moenchengladbach was hosting Schalke in the late game.
